- *For other implementations of the monster, see [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus "Cerberus").*

**Cerberus**, d, is a [deferred](/wiki/Deferred_feature "Deferred feature") [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") in the [source code](/wiki/Source_code "Source code") of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. He is a monster that is part of the [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), and is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Cerberus has three bite attacks, and possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") Cerberus's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a chance of conveying fire resistance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Cerberus is not generated anywhere, but has rules governing his generation like any other monster.

Cerberus will always be created hostile, and he is not a valid target for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

## History

Cerberus's data first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Several variants of *NetHack* fully implement Cerberus and grant the monster additional traits and abilities depending on the variant.

### SLASH'EM

- *Main article: [Cerberus (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Cerberus_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Cerberus (SLASH'EM)")*

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Cerberus (dNetHack)](/wiki/Cerberus_\(dNetHack\) "Cerberus (dNetHack)")*

### xNetHack

- *Main article: [Cerberus (xNetHack)](/wiki/Cerberus_\(xNetHack\) "Cerberus (xNetHack)")*

### EvilHack

- *Main article: [Cerberus (EvilHack)](/wiki/Cerberus_\(EvilHack\) "Cerberus (EvilHack)")*

## Encyclopedia entry

Cerberus, (or Kerberos in Greek), was the three-headed dog  
that guarded the Gates of Hell. He allowed any dead to enter,  
and likewise prevented them all from ever leaving. He was  
bested only twice: once when Orpheus put him to sleep by  
playing bewitching music on his lyre, and the other time when  
Hercules confronted him and took him to the world of the  
living (as his twelfth and last labor).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 290](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L290)

Cerberus (monster)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
d Cerberus

Attacks Bite 3d6 physical, Bite 3d6 physical, Bite 3d6 physical
d Cerberus
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Bite 3d6 physical, Bite 3d6 physical, Bite 3d6 physical

Base level 12
Base experience ?
Speed 10
Base AC 2
Base MR 20
Alignment −7 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1000
Nutritional value 350
Size large
Resistances fire resistance
Resistances conveyed fire

Cerberus:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
Reference monst.c#line290
For other implementations of the monster, see Cerberus.

Cerberus, d, is a deferred monster in the source code of NetHack. He is a monster that is part of the canine monster class, and is a carnivorous animal that is strong and can be seen via infravision.[1]

Cerberus has three bite attacks, and possesses fire resistance.

Eating Cerberus's corpse or tin has a chance of conveying fire resistance.

Generation

Cerberus is not generated anywhere, but has rules governing his generation like any other monster.

Cerberus will always be created hostile, and he is not a valid target for polymorph.

History

Cerberus's data first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

Several variants of NetHack fully implement Cerberus and grant the monster additional traits and abilities depending on the variant.

SLASH'EM

Main article: Cerberus (SLASH'EM)

Encyclopedia entry

Cerberus, (or Kerberos in Greek), was the three-headed dog
that guarded the Gates of Hell. He allowed any dead to enter,
and likewise prevented them all from ever leaving. He was
bested only twice: once when Orpheus put him to sleep by
playing bewitching music on his lyre, and the other time when
Hercules confronted him and took him to the world of the
living (as his twelfth and last labor).

References

  1. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 290

He is a monster that is part of the [[canine]] [[monster class]], and is a [[carnivorous]] [[animal]] that is [[strong]] and can be seen via [[infravision]].{{refsrc|src/monst.c|290|nethack=3.6.7}}

Cerberus has three bite attacks, and possesses [[fire resistance]].

[[Eating]] Cerberus's [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a chance of conveying fire resistance.

==Generation==
Cerberus is not generated anywhere, but has rules governing his generation like any other monster.

Cerberus will always be created hostile, and he is not a valid target for [[polymorph]].

==History==
Cerberus's data first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
Several variants of ''NetHack'' fully implement Cerberus and grant the monster additional traits and abilities depending on the variant.
